privacy.title: Privacy policy
privacy.metaDescription: Privacy policy for The Playground â€” data collected, purposes, GDPR rights and cookies.
privacy.intro: The Playground, published by The Spark SASU, is committed to protecting the privacy of its users. This policy describes the data we collect, why we use it and what your rights are.

items.email: Email address (sign-in via magic link or OAuth)
items.name: First and last name (provided during onboarding)
items.oauth: OAuth account identifier (Google, GitHub) â€” for authentication only

sharing.title: Data sharing
sharing.content: Your personal data is never sold or shared with third parties for commercial purposes. It may be transmitted to our technical subcontractors (hosting, email delivery) solely to ensure the operation of the service.

cookies.title: Cookies
cookies.content: The Playground only uses cookies strictly necessary for the operation of the site (authentication session). No advertising or third-party tracking cookies are used.

rights.title: Your rights (GDPR)
rights.content: In accordance with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), you have the following rights:

items.access: Right to access your personal data
items.deletion: Right to erasure of your data

rights.contact: To exercise these rights, contact us at dragos@thespark.fr.

retention.title: Data retention
retention.content: Your data is retained as long as your account is active. If your account is deleted, your personal data will be erased within 30 days.

terms.title: Terms of use
terms.metaDescription: Terms of use for The Playground â€” acceptance, service description, responsibilities and applicable law.
terms.intro: These terms of use ("Terms") govern the use of The Playground platform, published by The Spark SASU.

acceptance.title: Acceptance of Terms
acceptance.content: By using The Playground, you accept these Terms in their entirety. If you do not accept these conditions, please do not use the service.

service.title: Service description
service.content: The Playground is a free platform for creating Communities and organizing Events. The service is accessible via the web and is provided "as is".

account.title: User account
account.content: Access to the service requires creating an account via email (magic link) or via an OAuth provider (Google, GitHub). You are responsible for the confidentiality of your account and all activity that occurs under it.

userContent.title: User content
userContent.content: You are solely responsible for content you publish on The Playground (Community descriptions, Event descriptions, comments). Any unlawful, defamatory, discriminatory or otherwise inappropriate content is prohibited and may be removed without notice.

hostResponsibilities.title: Host responsibilities
hostResponsibilities.content: As a Host, you are responsible for the accuracy of information related to your Events (location, date, description). You agree to comply with all applicable laws regarding event organization.

playerResponsibilities.title: Member responsibilities
playerResponsibilities.content: As a Member, you agree to respect the rules of each Community and Event you participate in. Joining an Event constitutes a commitment to attend.

pricing.title: Pricing
pricing.content: The Playground is entirely free to use. No commission is charged by the platform. For paid Events, only Stripe transaction fees (approximately 2.9% + $0.30) apply and are borne by the Host.

liability.title: Limitation of liability
liability.content: The Spark SASU shall not be liable for any direct or indirect damages resulting from the use of the service, including but not limited to service interruption, data loss or disputes between Hosts and Members.

modification.title: Modification of Terms
modification.content: The Spark SASU reserves the right to modify these Terms at any time. Users will be notified of changes by email or notification on the platform. Continued use of the service after modification constitutes acceptance of the new conditions.

law.title: Applicable law
law.content: These Terms are governed by French law. In the event of a dispute, the competent courts of Paris shall have exclusive jurisdiction.
